text: This is so painfully cliched in every imaginable way, I see no redeeming qualities. The pacing looks to be awful, the visuals Dredd without the spunk. No respect given to any source material in terms of character for sure. I see they kept the visual elements that whoever watched the original movie liked the most (freefall, optical-camo chase, cybertank fight behind rebar column) and somehow managed to adapt it with so much CGI there is nothing left for the eye. Surely no philosophical questions will be presented, no new encounters or proposals involving the bounty of rich technology and transhumanism found in all other GitS.   The masses don't deserve something as good as GitS unless they do further digging anyways, so this is actually very pleasing.   Parting thought on the tagline "They created me, but they cannot control me." There is a part of the manga alluding to the Tachikomas AI becoming self aware and eliminating humanity, with them realizing there is nothing to gain if they did so. In fact, the Major herself and Section 9 are both operating upon the basis that they are their own masters, a key distinction that leaves this movie looking even more brain dead. There is no Ghost in this movie's shell, which is always a saddening sight.
